result.execSummary:
The defendant Kirsten L Dowdy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kirsten L Dowdy is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kirsten L Dowdy was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kirsten L Dowdy

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kirsten L Dowdy in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant would like to accept the offer.   Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  Atty Hendee states that there was an error in the agreement as it should be $442.00 not $422.00.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant is in agreement to the $442.00.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.
  Defendant waives their right to an attorney and wants to proceed today.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  
Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Pay fine and costs = $442.00
Ct. 2 to be dismissed.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in May.
Defendant agrees to $15.00 PPF.

Defendant Kirsten L Dowdy in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant wanted to get an Attorney and today's date was set.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant does not want to get an Attorney and wants to meet with the DA.
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Court accepts defendant's waiver.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.

Atty Hendee states that an offer is done and asks that he be able to provide that to the defendant.
Court advises the defendant to pick the offer up at his office.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.

*If the defendant wants to accept the offer today; the Court will give the option for the hearing to be held today yet.  Return date scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Return date on April 1, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Kirsten L Dowdy in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.    
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.   Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions. 
Defendant does not object.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant would like to get a court appointed Attorney.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.  Return date scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
